title: 3 people dead, child injured in Bristol shooting
content:
SULLIVAN COUNTY, Tenn. (WVLT) -- The Sullivan County Sheriff's Office is investigating a triple homicide that occurred Saturday afternoon in Bristol, Tennessee.
Police were notified of a shooting at 5:45 pm. Upon arrival, officers found two women with gunshots wounds. They were pronounced dead at the scene according to officials. The shooting took place at 618 Henson road.
A man, who also suffered gunshot wounds, was airlifted to Johnson City Medical Center where he later died.
Police say a child in the home received non-life threatening injuries and was transported to Bristol Regional Medical Center for treatment.
Officers located a suspect, with a non-life threatening gunshot wound, and took him into custody. The suspect was transported to British Regional Medical Center.
The investigation is ongoing.
